channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2025070415
item.description:
Report E-2025070415

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-17
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The drum was unloaded by our forklift operator. The operator immediately noticed a leak coming from under the pallet. The shrink wrap was cut off, the leak was identified, and the drum was immediately turned over to prevent any further spillage. The leaked product was cleaned up with absorbents and placed in an overpack container. The damaged drum was placed in a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025070345
item.description:
Report E-2025070345

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-10
  • City: CARTERET
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift loader was moving freight in the area and pushed into the hazmat pallet. The forkblade pushed into the box and punctured 1 can of paint inside the box. The spill was immediately responded to. 1 gallon of paint was spilled. Absorbents were placed in the area to clean up the spill. The damaged containers were placed in an overpack container. All clean up materials were placed in a separate overpack in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025070191
item.description:
Report E-2025070191

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-03
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The trailer was picked up as a shipper load and count. Upon arriving at our facility, the dockworker noticed several pallets tipped over including the pallet with the spill. Immediate action was taken to upright the drum and stop the leak. Roughly 8oz of liquid seeped from the closure. The drum was placed in an overpack container in preparation for disposition or reuse after thoroughly cleaning the drum. All spilled fluid was neutralized and swept up using absorbents.

item.title: Report X-2025071002
item.description:
Report X-2025071002

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 3 KGS OF UNDECLARED DRY ICE COOLING SPECIMENS. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING SHIPPER NUMBER E3E522, LABCORP CLS UPS EXPRESS, 911 GRADE LN, LOUISVILLE KY 40213-2618.

item.description:
Report E-2025070083

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AS THE SHIPMENT WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM A TRAILER, THE DOCKWORKER NOTICED A WET BOX CONTAINING 4 GALLONS OF PAINT. THE LID ON ONE OF THE CONTAINERS IN THE BOX HAD POPPED OFF IN TRANSIT. THE SPILL WAS IMMEDIATELY CLEANED UP. THE DAMAGED CONTAINER WAS PLACED IN AN OVERPACK PAIL. SPILL CLEAN UP MATERIALS AND DAMAGED BOX WERE ALSO PACKED IN A SEPARATE OVERPACK CONTAINER IN PREPARATION FOR DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2025070268
item.description:
Report E-2025070268

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: KENILWORTH
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 30, 2025, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them up with hand tools. A pressure washing unit was utilized to remediate the impacted asphalt. All product and absorbents were placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report E-2025060484

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment arrived at Pyle and was being unloaded when the leak was found. It was found that a nail protruding from the pallet punctured the pail causing the leak. The damaged jerrican was immediately contained in an overpack container. The small release of corrosive liquid was absorbed and packed in an additional overpack in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2025061566
item.description:
Report X-2025061566

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipper wrapped the pallet containing 4 batteries so tight that it compromised the top on the battery causing it to leak fluid. Upon discovery of the spill, the dockworker immediately notified dock leadership and began clean up of the spilled fluid. The spilled fluid was neutralized and cleaned up with absorbents. The battery and clean up materials were packed in separate overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025070423
item.description:
Report E-2025070423

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: SOUTH PLAINFIELD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-30ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that twenty-five (25) gallons of material were released from one (1) 55-gallon steel drum. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents. After the absorbents were collected up, a neutral soap was applied to the affected areas and then pressure washed. Petroleum distillates impacted water, and granular absorbents were containerized into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums. ESTES reviewed all work before contractor demobilization. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal
